page.title: 12TRAINS AND CANALS IN ROMSEY
page.content:
We looked at the trains along the tracks. We decided they went into five sets and counted up which ones came most often. The signal box is modern and electronic but the old signal box is in our school grounds with all the levers. It will be restored by the Romsey and District Preservation Trust. The canal was built to go between Andover and Redbridge shortly before the railway so it was not used much. Coal and heavy things were moved on it. There was a wharf at the Harrage. Not much remains; just the Timsbury - Harrage section and part at Nursling.
Compiled by Romsey County Infants School.
